children.name: to die because you are old or ill
die a1
children.definition: die to stop being alive, as a result of old age or illness:chết
examples: i want to see ireland again before i die.
many people are worried about growing old and dying alone.
no wonder your plants always die - you don’t water them enough.
die of
his son died of liver cancer three years ago.
die in your sleepdie while you are sleeping
in the spring of her 93rd year, miss grantley died in her sleep.
die a natural death/ die of natural causesdie as a result of illness or old age
the autopsy said he had died of natural causes, but his family is not convinced.

children.name: pass away b2
children.definition: pass away to die - use this when you want toavoidusing the word ‘die’, because you think it might upset someone:qua đời
examples: have you heard? carl passed away last night.
my wife had just passed away, and i didn’t want to be around people.

children.name: drop dead c2
children.definition: drop deadspokenif someone drops dead, they die verysuddenlyandunexpectedly, especially when they are in the middle of doing something:chết đột ngột
examples: one of their neighbors just dropped dead on the tennis court.
mcsherry dropped dead of a heart attack in the middle of a baseball game.

children.name: kick the bucket x
children.definition: kick the bucketspokeninformal/snuffituk  to die - use this humorously when you are not being serious:chết
examples: when i kick the bucket you’ll be able to live on my life insurance.
i feel like i’ve done everything i wanted to - i might as well snuff it.

children.name: to die in a war, accident, fight etc
die a1
children.definition: die/be killed a2chết
examples: the firefighters died when the warehouse floor collapsed.
die/ be killed in an accident/ explosion/ the war etc
two people were killed and four injured in a gas explosion this morning.
die/ be killed in actionbe killed in a war
his brother was killed in action in vietnam.

children.name: to death c2
children.definition: to deathstarve/ freeze/ bleed etc to deathto die because of having no food, being too cold, losing blood etc:đến chết
examples: the baby starved to death.
he bled to death after being stabbed repeatedly.

children.name: lose your life b2
children.definition: lose your life to be killed in a terrible event - used especially innewsreportsand descriptions ofpastevents:mất mạng , thiệt mạng
examples: hundreds of people lost their lives when the ship overturned in a storm.
supporters continue to visit the site where colosio lost his life to an assassin’s bullet.

children.name: come to a sticky end x
children.definition: come to a sticky end ukinformalto die in a violent or unpleasant way - use this especially when you think the person who died deserved this:chết thảm hại
examples: at the end of the film the prisoners are rescued, and the pirates come to a sticky end.

children.name: perish x
children.definition: perish to die in a terrible event - used especially in literature and news reports:bỏ mạng
examples: everyone aboard the ship perished when it sank off the coast of maine.
five children perished before firefighters could put out the blaze.

children.name: suffer heavy losses u
children.definition: suffer heavy losses if amilitaryforcesuffers heavy losses, a very large number of its soldiers die while fighting:chịu tổn thất lớn
examples: us forces withdrew after suffering heavy losses.
the troops suffered heavy losses fighting their way through the italian countryside.

children.name: fall x
children.definition: fall literary if soldiers fall while fighting, they are killed : ngã xuống
examples: many brave men fell in the fight to save the city.
during the war, he saw many of his comrades fallin battle.

children.name: when one of your relatives or friends dies
lose b2
children.definition: lose if you lose a close relative or friend, they die:mất (ai)
examples: sharon lost her mother when she was very young.
it’s a terrible thing to lose someone very close to you.

children.name: be widowed x
children.definition: bewidowed if you are widowed, your husband or wife dies:bị góa
examples: tony’s mother was widowed at the age of 23 with three children.

children.name: be orphaned x
children.definition: beorphaned if you are orphaned, both your parents die when you are still young:bị mồ côi
examples: ben was orphaned at an early age and raised by an uncle.

children.name: bereaved x
children.definition: bereavedformalused about sb whose close relative or friend has died:tang quyến/ gia quyến
examples: the bereaved mother stood by her son’s grave.
bereaved family members are demanding more information about the plane crash.
the bereaved[cp] people whose relations or friends have recently died : tang quyến
it is generally accepted that the bereaved benefit from counselling.
bereavement[u] when a close relative or friend of yours dies.
jim’s depression had been brought on by the bereavement he had suffered earlier in the year.
bereavement counsellors people have been trained to help people who have been bereaved flown to the city.

children.name: leave x
children.definition: leave to leave a wife, husband or other close family member is to die while these family members are still alive : bỏ lại
examples: he left a wife and two children.

children.name: when sb is going to die very soon
dying x
children.definition: dying if sb is dying, they will die very soon because they are very ill or very badly injured:hấp hối
examples: he gave the dying man a drop of water from his flask.
the priest was killed as he was giving the last rites to a dying man.
lie dying
even as she lay dying in a hospital bed, she was still thinking of her children.
the dyingpeople who are about to die
these nurses specialize in the care of the dying.

children.name: be close to death b1
children.definition: be close to death/ near (to) deathformalto be going to die very soon:cận kề cái chết, sắp chết
examples: when the fisherman spotted the boat, its crew were already close to death.
davis had suffered a stroke and was near death.

children.name: on your deathbed x
children.definition: on your deathbed to be lying in your bed, about to die:trên giường bệnh
examples: my grandmother gave me that ring when she was on her deathbed.
thirty years later, on her deathbed, she confessed to the crime.
she spoke to her familyfromher deathbed.

children.name: be at death’s door x
children.definition: be at death’s door informal spoken to be extremely ill and likely to die soon:sắp chết
examples: his skin was so pale, he looked like he was at death’s door.

children.name: in extremis x
children.definition: in extremisspecialized at the point of death lúc lâm chung

children.name: death b1
children.definition: deathcái chết
examples: after her husband’s death, she moved back to california.
the bomb caused at least one death, and several serious injuries.
death from
the number of deaths from aids is still increasing in many parts of the world.
the death of sbformalcái chết của ai
a comet appeared at the time of the death of julius caesar in 44 b.c.
accidental deathdeath resulting from an accident - used inofficialcontexts :
the policy provides full insurance in the case of accidental death.
untimely deathdeath that comes earlier than is normally expected :
basquiat’s work had become well known even before his untimely death at age 27.
on sb’s deathwhen they die
catherine will inherit a large sum of money on her father’s death.

children.name: fatalities x
children.definition: fatalities the number of people who have died in accidents or from illnesses, especially when this is being calculated officially:các trường hợp tử vong
examples: a fifth of all road fatalities are caused by people not wearing seatbelts.
britain has thousands of road fatalities (= deaths on roads) every year.
an attack on the city would cause tens of thousands of civilian fatalities.
the first fatalities of the war were civilians.

children.name: loss of life x
children.definition: loss of life formal the deaths of people in an accident or a war:tổn thất sinh mạng
examples: the plane managed to crash-land on st. lawrence island with no loss of life.
the plane crashed with serious loss of life.
the bishop condemned what he called ‘this futile and tragic loss of life’.

children.name: to die when you are still young
die young a1
children.definition: die young to die when you are young:chết trẻ
examples: like so many other pop stars, jim morrison died young.
a memorial to tens of thousands of allied soldiers, many of whom died so young

children.name: be cut off in your prime x
children.definition: be cut off/down in your prime to die when you are still young, strong, and active, as a result of an accident, sudden illness etc:chết sớm giữa tuổi thanh xuân
examples: the movie tells the story of a popular athlete cut down in his prime.
be cut off/ down in your prime by
dolly was an energetic woman who was suddenly cut off in her prime by scarlet fever.

children.name: to die for your country or for sth you believe in
die for a1
children.definition: die fortử vì
examples: these brave men were ready to fight and die for their country.
how many of you would be willing to die for your religion?

children.name: give your life x
children.definition: give your life/ lay down your life formal to die in order to save sb, or because of sth that you believe in:hy sinh
examples: we want to pay special tribute to the men and women who have given their lives in service of their country.
give your life/ lay down your life for
he was ready to lay down his life for his comrades.

children.name: martyr x
children.definition: martyr sb who is killed because of their religious or political beliefs, and becomes very famous because of this:thánh tử, thánh tử đạo
examples: the early christian martyrs were killed by the thousands.
make sb a martyr/ make a martyr out of sbmake people think sb is a martyr
his death in police hands made him a martyr among the people.
a christian/ islamic/ religious martyr
she fought against racism all her life and died a martyrto the cause.
martyrdom[u]
his martyrdom encouraged the people to resist.

children.name: the body of a dead person or animal
body a2
children.definition: body the body of sb who has recently died: thi thể
examples: police found the body of a young boy in epping forest last night.
the woman fell to her knees beside her son’s body and began crying and wailing.
the bodies of the two soldiers were buried with full military honors at arlington national cemetery.
dead body
the first time i ever saw a dead body was at my grandfather’s funeral.

children.name: corpse c2
children.definition: corpse the body of a dead person, used when you consider the body as an object and not as a person: tử thi; thi hài, xác chết
examples: thieves are digging up corpses in order to steal jewellery and gold teeth.
the streets were filled with the stench of decaying corpses.

children.name: remains x
children.definition: remains formal the parts of sb’s body that remain after they die, especially after their body has been dead for a long time:
examples: they found the remains of a young woman under the floor boards.
these rocks contain the fossilised remains of extinct animals.
sb'sremains
fifty years after he died, his remains were returned to his homeland.
the architect’s remains are interred in st paul’s cathedral.
human remains
human remains were found in the woods.

children.name: ashes x
children.definition: ashes the white powder that is left after a body has been burned as part of a funeral ceremony: tro cốt
examples: her ashes werescatteredat sea.
they burned gandhi’s body and scattered the ashes on the waters of the jumna river.
kay kept her father’s ashes in an urn on the mantelpiece.

children.name: drown b2
children.definition: drownverbdiechết đuối
examples: [ i or t ] to (cause to) die by being unable to breathe under water
_he drowned in a boating accident.
_many animals were drowned by the tidal wave.

children.name: suffocate x
children.definition: suffocateverbdielàm chết ngạt, bóp nghẹt; làm nghẹt thở
examples: to (cause someone to) die because they do not have enough oxygen
_the report said that the victims had suffocated in the fumes.
_she suffocated him by holding a pillow over his head.

children.name: death wish x
children.definition: death wishnoun(sự) mong mỏi cái chết đến với mình hoặc với người khác
examples: adesirefor death
_the chances he takes,you'd think he had a death wish.

children.name: mortality c2
children.definition: mortality formal the number of deaths within a particular society and within a particular period of time : con số tử vong
examples: mortality from heart disease varies widely across the world.
infant/ child/ maternal/ adult mortality
infantmortality is much higher in the poorest areas of the city.
the mortalityrate
an appallingly highinfant mortality rate(= number of babies who die)

children.name: casualty c2
children.definition: casualty sb who is hurt or killed in an accident or war :thương vong
examples: our aim is to reduceroad casualties.
the train was derailed but there were no casualties, police said.
civilian casualties(= people who are not soldiers who are injured or killed )
cause/ inflict casualties
the rebels have inflictedheavy casualties.
the rebelssuffered heavycasualties.

children.name: death toll c2
children.definition: the death toll the number of deaths in one terrible event : số người chết
examples: the latest death toll in the turkish earthquake is over 2000.
the day after the explosion the death toll had risen to 90.
independent sources say that thedeathtoll from the earthquake runs into thousands.
